snippet: The odyssey of the short sale of a Florida condominium is another example of dysfunction in the mortgage market.
abstract: Gretchen Morgenson Fair Game column describes the obstacles encountered by the short sale of a Florida condominium, saying it is one more example of dysfunction in the mortgage market; notes while the government has given the greater push to loan modification programs, short sales are crucial to cutting the inventory of foreclosed properties; cites borrowers who have tried to work with banks and report responses ranging from reluctance to outright recalcitrance.
lead_paragraph: The odyssey of the short sale of a Florida condominium is another example of dysfunction in the mortgage market.
